NGO Leaders in Humanitarian Aid and Development Seminar Series

From Poverty to Power
Co-sponsored with
The Center for International Development

Duncan Green
Head of Research, Oxfam GB

Lant Pritchett
Professor of the Practice of International Development, HKS

Duncan Green discusses his new book, From Poverty to Power, which proposes realistic solutions to the human and economic costs of global inequality and poverty. A new take on development for the 21st century, he argues for active citizenship, effective states, and a redistribution of the power within markets to make economic growth work for poor people. Mr. Green will highlight the implications for international development NGOs and their approach to reducing poverty, with Lant Pritchett responding to these ideas and setting them in the context of the latest thinking in development economics.

Duncan Green is Head of Research at Oxfam GB (http://www.oxfam.org....) and author of From Poverty to Power: How Active Citizens and Effective States can Change the World (Oxfam International, June 2008).
